@ArchdukeAegis

A man of culture I see, honestly seeing someone with this much love for Greek mythology is refreshing.

Now pull this back a bit, and remember Athena and Dionysus are engaged, meaning that another pair of siblings are soon to be married. Damned Greeks man, so much incest. Literally all the incest. Also Zeus is an asshole. This story shows the Greek Pantheon too well tbh.

If you think about this in terms of the actual mythology it just gets weirder and weirder, yet more believable. Zeus is having sexual relations with his older sister, Hades and meanwhile holds a tournament among the rest of his family. Which includes his other sisters and half-sisters, forcing even those bound by a vow of virginity such as Artemis and Hestia into having sex and then Aphrodite, Hermes, Athena, Apollo, Artemis, Persephone (The twins, Perse & Phone in this story's case), Hephaestus, Ares and Dionysus are all half-siblings some of them actual siblings in the case of Artemis and Apollo. Meaning these two chapters consist of half-sisters and daughters of Zeus, Aphrodite and Hermes fucking and then Aphrodite later proposing her love to her half-brother, Ares. Hermes additionally views her half-brother Hephaestus as a more father figure , and Aphrodite was already with her half-brother Hephaestus now making this a public affair.
I was struggling with my homework but after reading this I got it. Thanks!
I feel smarter now that i've read this.
